column4: Does anybody know what the + symbol means in the list of Usplashes when doing "sudo update-alternatives --config usplash-artwork.so"?
Doesnt it represent a bullet point?
it doesn't make sense. Are you under Ubuntu?
They are simply symbols used to seperate information: see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bullet_point
The * means that it's the actual Usplash in use.
Ah. I think the + actually represents what is currently selected
If I change the Usplash to the second one, the * appears next to the second option but the + sign still remains on the first one.
Okay, BeRniTo: The * means what is selected within the dialogue box, and the + means what your usplash is currently set to
Select the 2nd option and confirm it, the + will move there next time you open the dialogue
no, It doesn't. That's why I'm searching for it's meaning. :P
